title: Beautifully Nourished's Detox
description: Aloe Vera, Psyllium Husk, Konjac Glucomannan, with added Probiotic Lactobacillus Acidophilus and extracts of Anise Seed, Liquorice Root, Buckthorn, Rhubarb Root and Cranberry. Naturally, cleanse the body of toxic build-up and promote healthy and friendly gut bacteria.
cleaned_text: What is a Detox? Our bodies have a natural detoxification system in place that filters and removes toxic substances from our bodies. Our bodies detox every single day through organs including the liver, kidney, and the lymphatic system. While our bodies are incredibly intelligent, sometimes they need help with detoxifying due to the inescapable toxins brought on by our lifestyle and environments. What a Detox is Not As much as social media would like us to believe, a detox is not something that we "do" to our body, it is a natural process, that we can support. Supporting the Body's Detoxification System The perfect gut health vitamins . Featuring Aloe Vera, Anise Seed and Rhubarb Root for detoxification support, Beautifully Nourished's Detox tablets aim to support the body's natural detoxification process as the body naturally cleanses toxins and impurities . It does this by providing key nutrients that can offset pollutants, neutralise free radicals and support digestive enzymes. Beautifully Nourished's Detox supplement additionally supports gut health, with probiotic Lactobacillus Acidophilus, which can help to maintain a healthy balance of bacteria within the digestive tract. How it Works The liver is the main organ involved in detoxifying the body, as it filters the blood, helping to rid it of impurities and disabling toxins such as ethanol, environmental poisons and pesticides. Beautifully Nourished's Detox formula features vitamin C, which protects cells from oxidative stress, Aloe Vera and Calcium, which contributes to the normal function of digestive enzymes. No alcohol should be consumed whilst taking this supplement to further support the detoxification process. Key Ingredients Vegan Probiotic, lactobacillus Acidpophilus: Lactobacillus acidophilus is a probiotic bacteria. This bacteria helps the digestive system [break down sugars](https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/324194), such as lactose, into lactic acid. Psyllium Husk: Detox herb, Psyllium Husk comes from a shrub-like herb called Plantago psyllium. The husk is the outer coating of the psyllium seed. It's a rich source of fibre, making it beneficial for gut health. Psyllium also works by helping your bowels to retain more water. By binding to food, more liquid is absorbed in the intestines. This helps the body to form a heavier, softer stool that's easier to pass. Calcium Carbonate: Calcium carbonate is used as an antacid to relieve indigestion and upset stomach. Cranberry Extract: Supports digestive health. Cranberries are packed with antioxidants and can [help](https://www.healthline.com/nutrition/uti-home-remedies) reduce the frequency of urinary tract infections in some people. We feature cranberry extract alongside Vitamin C and Probiotic Lactobacillus acidophilus to enhance it's affects. Inulin Powder: Inulin is a soluble fibre that nourishes gut microbes, eases constipation, and [h](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17298707/) [elps body to absorb calcium and magnesium.](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/17298707/) *Konjac Glucomannan: Glucomannan is a fibre that can feed the friendly bacteria in the intestine. It can lower blood sugar, blood cholesterol and triglycerides, and is very effective against constipation. Konjac Glucomannan is the only ingredient with an EFSA weight loss claim for Humans. It is a type of fibre found in the roots of the elephant yam, also called Konjac. Glucomannan absorbs water and becomes gel-like, promoting the feeling of fullness. Ascorbic Acid: Vitamin C, also known as L-ascorbic acid, is often used as the first line of defence to ward off a cold, however not many people know about its powerful detoxifying capabilities, especially when it comes to heavy metals such as lead and mercury. [Studies](https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0891584900004135) have shown that vitamin C can reduce the build up of lead in the liver and kidneys. Aloe Vera: The water-dense aloe plant has been shown to aid constipation relief and is rich in vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants - nutrients needed by the liver, kidneys and detox organs to function optimally. Anise Seed Extract: [Anis](https://www.rxlist.com/anise/supplements.htm)e is a detox herb used to ease an upset stomach an, or intestinal gas. Fennel Seed Extract: Fennel is well known to [support with digestive issues](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2736926/), often consumed as fennel tea to soothe the stomach. Fennel has also been found to flush the body of excess fluids through its diuretic properties. Rhubarb Root Extract: Rhubarb is rich in antioxidants, particularly anthocyanins (which give it its red color) and proanthocyanidins. These antioxidants have anti-bacterial and anti-inflammatory properties. [Rhubarb](https://www.webmd.com/diet/health-benefits-rhubarb#1) contains natural fibre to help keep things flowing through the digestive tract, preventing digestive issues such as constipation. Rhubarb also contains compounds called sennosides, which act as natural laxatives. The tannins in rhubarb also provide anti-diarrheal effects. Liquorice Root Extract: Liquorice Root Extract has been shown to soothe gastric and abdomen troubles. Buckthorn Extract: Buckthorn is extracted from the berries, leaves and seeds of the sea buckthorn plant (Hippophae rhamnoides), a small shrub that grows at high altitudes in the northwest Himalayan. It holds many nutrients and has been shown to [support a healthy liver](http://jprsolutions.info/newfiles/journal-file-56c9417e2d9172.38444530.pdf). Buckthorn contains healthy fats, vitamin E and carotenoids, all of which may safeguard liver cells from damage. Gentian Root Extract: Genetian is a herb used for digestion problems such as bloating, diarrhoea, and heartburn. It is thought to to stimulate digestion by increasing saliva production and promoting stomach acid and digestive enzyme production.
